events.heading: Interned at Georgetown University School of Medicine
events.body: During my senior year of high school, I received the unique opportunity to intern at Georgetown University as a part of a mentorship program. I got to study neurons that regulated the gastrointestinal system of mice. I learned so much about electrophysiology and neurobiology, and my amazing mentor taught me life lessons that I will cherish forever.

events.heading: Graduated from TJHSST
events.body: These were a quite stressful 4 years of my life, but I was able to push through and earn an Advanced Diploma. Some cool classes I took include Artificial Intelligence, Web App Development, Multivariable Calculus, and DNA Science. I was also a member of some really interesting clubs, such as Bioengineering Projects for the Future, Innovations in Concepts of Engineering, and Spanish Honor Society. I was also on the Varsity Football team for 3 years.

events.heading: First Job at Mathnasium
events.body: This was my first real job, and I enjoyed it much more than I thought going in. I tutored kids in K-12 about math concepts and helped them sharpen their logical reasoning skills. This job opened my eyes to how much I enjoy teaching others (and unexpectedly, working with kids).

events.heading: Summer Tutor for Acakid
events.body: Continuing from my previous job at Mathnasium, I decided to continue tutoring kids since I enjoyed it so much. I worked throughout the summer to keep busy and earn some money for college.
